co.paralleluniverse.galaxy

Interface Cluster


  • public interface Cluster
    The cluster management service. Provides information and events on the nodes comprising the grid's cluster. The cluster manages most of the information via a DistributedTree that's implemented either on top of JGroups or Apache ZooKeeper.

    • Method Detail

      • getMyNodeId

        short getMyNodeId()
        Returns this cluster node's ID. The ID is not unique in the cluster - a master and its slaves all share the same ID.
        Returns:
        This cluster node's ID.

      • getMyNodeInfo

        NodeInfo getMyNodeInfo()
        Returns this cluster node's info. This node's name (accessed through NodeInfo.getName()) is unique in the cluster.
        Returns:
        This cluster node's info.

      • getNodeInfoByName

        NodeInfo getNodeInfoByName(String nodeName)
        Returns a NodeInfo for any cluster node, identified by its (unique) name.
        Parameters:
        nodeName - The node's (unique) name.
        Returns:
        The node's information.

      • getNodesByProperty

        Set<NodeInfo> getNodesByProperty(String propertyName,
                               Object value)
        Returns a set of NodeInfo for any cluster node, with a property equal to the given value.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - The property we want to compare to the given value.
        value - The requested value of the property.
        Returns:
        The nodes having the requested property value.

      • hasServer

        boolean hasServer()
        Returns true if the grid is configured to use a server.
        Returns:
        true if the grid is configured to use a server; false otherwise.

      • isOnline

        boolean isOnline()
        Returns true if this node is online (operational and visible to other nodes).
        Returns:
        true if this node is online and false otherwise.

      • isMaster

        boolean isMaster()
        Returns true if this node is a master; false if it's a slave.
        Returns:
        true if this node is a master; false if it's a slave.

      • getNodes

        Set<Short> getNodes()
        Returns the IDs of all online nodes (each master and slaves group of nodes is listed once - remember: masters and slaves share the same ID).
        Returns:
        A set containing the IDs of all online nodes.

      • getMasters

        Collection<NodeInfo> getMasters()
        Returns all the current, online master nodes.
        Returns:
        A collection containing all the current, online master nodes.

      • getMyMaster

        NodeInfo getMyMaster()
        Returns this node's master node if this is a slave.
        Returns:
        This node's master node if this is a slave and null otherwise.

      • getMySlaves

        List<NodeInfo> getMySlaves()
        Returns this node's master node if this is a slave.
        Returns:
        This node's master node if this is a slave. null otherwise.

      • getMaster

        NodeInfo getMaster(short node)
        Returns a given node-group master if this node is a slave.
        Parameters:
        node - The node ID of the mater-slaves group (remember: masters and slaves share the same ID) the master of which we want.
        Returns:
        The master of the given node-group.

        Returns true if the given node is a master; false if it's a slave.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if the given node is a master; false if it's a slave.

      • getDistributedTree

        DistributedTree getDistributedTree()
        Returns the DistributedTree used by the cluster. You may use the tree for your own purposes. The cluster protects any internal Galaxy data in the tree from accidental deletion or modification.
        Returns:
        The DistributedTree used by the cluster.

      • addNodeProperty

        void addNodeProperty(String property,
                   boolean requiredForPeer,
                   boolean requiredForServer,
                   ReaderWriter<?> readerWriter)
        Adds a new node property that will be visible on the cluster.

        If required is true, tells the cluster that each node must have the given property set to a non-null value in order to be online. This would not normally be done by a user process, as it would require that his method be called during the Spring container initialization, i.e. in a Component's init() or postInit().

        Parameters:
        property - The property's name.
        requiredForPeer - Whether a non-null value for this property is required for the a peer to be online. For properties added by user processes, this should be false.
        requiredForServer - Whether a non-null value for this property is required for a server node to be online. For properties added by user processes, this should be false.
        readerWriter - A ReaderWriter instance to read and write this property to and from the distributed tree.

      • setNodeProperty

        void setNodeProperty(String property,
                   Object value)
        Sets a property for this node.
        Parameters:
        property - The property name being set.
        value - The new property value.

      • getUnderlyingResource

        Object getUnderlyingResource()
        Returns the main resource used by the cluster for coordination, namely a org.jgroups.JChannel for a JGroups-based cluster or a com.netflix.curator.framework.CuratorFramework for a ZooKeeper-based cluster.
        Returns:
        The main resource used by the cluster for coordination, currently of type org.jgroups.JChannel or org.apache.zookeeper.ZooKeeper.

      • goOffline

        void goOffline()
        Leave the cluster and shutdown the JVM. This would take the node offline and result in a call to LifecycleListener.offline(). This action cannot be reversed - the JVM must be restarted for the node to come back online.
